items.section_excerpt: The 500 year old mosque ,designed with a similar architectural style of mughal, display carvings on the all over structure associated with the history of their most prominent saints . It is one of the top tourist places of malappuram till date.

items.name: Mamburam: Muslim Pilgrimage
items.section_excerpt: Mamburam is a popular Muslim pilgrimage in Malappuram and one of the top mosques in Kerala. It houses shrines dedicated to the ancestors of primary Thangals. This was a significant title that was given to the Arabs from Yemen who migrated to Kerala. Thangals held prominent importance amongst locals and hence the shrine was later established here to immortalize them for the coming generations.
items.description: Mamburam is a popular Muslim pilgrimage in Malappuram and one of the top mosques in Kerala. It houses shrines dedicated to the ancestors of primary Thangals. Thangals held prominent importance amongst locals and hence the shrine was later established here to immortalize them for the coming generations.

items.name: Angadipuram Temple: The Capital City Of Valluvanad Kingdom
items.section_title: Angadipuram Temple: The Capital City Of Valluvanad Kingdom
items.section_excerpt: Angadipuram Temple is also known as Bhadrakali Temple and is located in Angadipuram city which once served as the capital city for Valluvanad kingdom. This is among the best tourist places in Malappuram. The temple is dedicated to Thirumandhamkunnu amma, the mother goddess of the empire. The temple hosts an annual festival of 11-days which is held in the months of March and April. This is one of t…
items.description: Angadipuram Temple is also known as Bhadrakali Temple and is located in Angadipuram city which once served as the capital city for Valluvanad kingdom. This is among the best tourist places in Malappuram. The temple is dedicated to Thirumandhamkunnu amma, the mother goddess of the empire. The temple hosts an annual festival of 11-days which is held in the months of March and April. This is one of the most popular temples in Malappuram.
query_hints: Angadipuram Temple: The Capital City Of Valluvanad Kingdom
Angadipuram Temple: The Capital City Of Valluvanad Kingdom Malappuram

items.name: Kadampuzha Temple: Oldest Temple In District
items.section_title: Kadampuzha Temple: Oldest Temple In District
items.section_excerpt: Kadampuzha Temple in Malappuram is amongst the oldest temple in the district and is located in the serene town called Melmuri of Tirur Taluk. The place is known for offering panoramic sights of the surrounding valleys. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Kadampuzha, a manifestation of Goddess Parvati.
items.description: Kadampuzha Temple in Malappuram is amongst the oldest temple in the district and is located in the serene town called Melmuri of Tirur Taluk. The place is known for offering panoramic sights of the surrounding valleys. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Kadampuzha, a manifestation of Goddess Parvati.

items.name: Biyyam Kayal: Stunning Backwater Lake
items.section_excerpt: You would be surprised to know that Malappuram is famous for its stunning backwater lakes and the most stunning amongst them is Biyyam Kayal. It is located in proximity to Ponnani and has been entitled as the adventure zone in the entire area. If you are an adventure junkie and looking for some daring expeditions here then you must surely head to Biyyam Kayal on your vacation to Malappuram.

items.name: Arimbra Hills: The Mini Ooty
items.section_excerpt: Visiting the Arimbra Hills might be one of the best things to do in Malappuram as it is known as “Mini Ooty” and a perfect getaway for nature lovers who love exploring impeccable places. It is located at an altitude of nearly 1,050 feet above the sea level and is known for offering spellbinding views of the surrounding valleys. The place is home to a few popular Jain temples that lure travelers fr…
items.description: Visiting the Arimbra Hills might be one of the best things to do in Malappuram as it is known as “Mini Ooty” and a perfect getaway for nature lovers who love exploring impeccable places. It is located at an altitude of nearly 1,050 feet above the sea level and is known for offering spellbinding views of the surrounding valleys. The place is home to a few popular Jain temples that lure travelers from near and far. This is among the best tourist places in Malappuram.
query_hints: Arimbra Hills: The Mini Ooty
Arimbra Hills: The Mini Ooty Malappuram

items.name: Adyanpara: Mesmerizing Waterfall
items.section_excerpt: Adyanpara is a mesmerizing waterfall that cascades naturally and is one of the most beautiful places to visit in Malappuram. It is located in Kumbalgodu village of Nilambur district and is well-connected to the city centre. The area has rich flora and fauna, making it the most enticing area around Malappuram.

items.name: Keraladeshapuram Temple: An Old Temple
items.section_excerpt: One of the oldest Hindu temples, this temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu that is situated about 3 km south of Tanur town in Kerala. Francis Xavier visited the temple in 1546 AD and the temple was also plundered by Tipu Sultan later.
